moves.1. b3: This game I am black, and playing OTB against, on average, the best player in our office.  I normally lose to him when he's white, but this time I pulled one out in high fashion.
moves.1... e5: I usually play the sicillian, but if he's going to give me the center I shall take it.
moves.2. Bb2 Nc6 3. e4 Nf6 4. d3: I don't like this move for white, I never use this move.  He's letting me develop pieces while he's moving pawns.
moves.4... Bc5 5. h3: White should not be defensive in the opening, this makes no sense right now because the N can't move to g4 without being snaked by the Queen.
moves.5... d5: Figure I would force the issue, and claim the middle.
moves.6. exd5 Nxd5 7. Nc3 Bd4 8. Nge2 O-O: I knew I had enough man power to at least come out even in a trade, so I elected to castle and leave him with many options to consider...and a desparate feeling of clausterphobia.
moves.9. Nxd4 exd4: Opening up the e-file and attacking his N
moves.10. Nxd5 Re8+: Here I knew no matter what I was going to have his N back, always check, it might be mate. :)
moves.11. Ne3 dxe3 12. fxe3 Rxe3+: Now he's is tremendously hot water.  There are slim to NO good options here.
moves.13. Kd2 Qg5 14. Kc3 Qa5+: Alert!  The king is in peril!  His only option is to allow mate, p-b4, QxP# ....K-c4, B-e6#!
moves.15. Kc4 Be6#: Black wins in swift fashion.  Mental note, don't move pawns while allowing your opponent to develop minor pieces.
